channel.title: Jason Kenney
channel.description: Recent news about Jason Kenney, from openparliament.ca.

item.title: Posted on Twitter
item.description: Great to see young CDN Ben Asselin win prestigious Encana Cup @Spruce_Meadows Masters. With proud Mom Nancy Southern: http://t.co/MFkSgE0ecE

item.title: Posted on Twitter
item.description: Also good to renew acquaintances with Polish Environment Minister Marcin Korolec at the @Spruce_Meadows Roundtable. #Poland.

item.title: Posted on Twitter
item.description: Met my remarkable German counterpart,Ursula Von Der Leyen,to discuss Germany's hugely successful dual training system http://t.co/Yexj4qFxUu

item.title: Posted on Twitter
item.description: 2/ private sector has to do more to invest in innovation, R&D, and training in particular; and job training should be demand driven. #jobs

item.description: Spruce Meadows roundtable was led by Jim McNerney, the impressive CEO of the Boeing Corporation, an $80B/yr company that employs 2000 Cdns.

item.title: Mentioned by Huffington Post Canada
item.description:
Jason Kenney's Speech To Islamic Group ISNA Erased From Government Sites
jason kenney ISNA. A speech made by Jason Kenney to the Islamic Society of North America (ISNA) has apparently been erased from government websites as Liberal Leader Justin Trudeau faces criticism for his association with the same group. item.title: Mentioned by Toronto Star
item.description:
Cabinet shuffle: Immigration advocates have hope for new minister
He replaces Jason Kenney, the Alberta MP who has been central to the Progressive Conservative's wooing of the ethnic vote across the GTA and Canada. Kenney, who some say has leadership ambitions, has been moved to the newly named portfolio of ...

item.title: Mentioned by Huffington Post Canada
item.description:
Jason Kenney's 10 Biggest Blunders as Immigration Minister
This spring, Alberta MP Jason Kenney became the longest continually serving Immigration Minister in Canadian history, according to his department. With the Cabinet Shuffle, his tenure ends. What better time to review the Immigration Minister's biggest ...

item.title: Mentioned by Calgary Herald
item.description:
Jason Kenney supports bill stripping citizenship for dual nationals linked to ...
Immigration Minister Jason Kenney appeared before committee Thursday to voice his support for a private member's bill that proposes to strip Canadian citizenship from dual nationals who commit acts of war against Canada and said he would like the bill broadened to also apply to dual citizens committing acts of terrorism and high treason. ... Bill sponsor Conservative MP Devinder Shory has said he is open to amendments that keep with the spirit of the bill and said the minister's suggestions were “attractive.”.
